cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles S of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across Cuba, then expected to turn northwest over the Gulf of Mexico and aim toward the upper Texas–south-west Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border, roughly Cameron Parish LA to Port Arthur–Beaumont TX area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect for parts of the Central Bahamas, Andros Island, Florida Keys and Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for portions of the Dominican Republic, Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks & Caicos, and nearly the entire Cuban coastline
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central and north-west Gulf Coast from upper Texas through Louisiana expected to receive hurricane conditions mid-week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds increasing to hurricane strength (70–90 mph gusts possible) as Laura approaches and crosses the coast near Beaumont
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–6 ft surge along Sabine Lake and adjacent coastal waterways if the center crosses near the Texas-Louisiana line
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands, significant marine/port swell and wave action disrupting vessel operations
